1.text: The wicked flee when no one pursues, but the righteous are as bold as a lion.

2.text: A land in rebellion has many rulers, but a man of understanding and knowledge maintains order.

3.text: A destitute leader who oppresses the poor is like a driving rain that leaves no food.

4.text: Those who forsake the law praise the wicked, but those who keep the law resist them.

5.text: Evil men do not understand justice, but those who seek the LORD comprehend fully.

6.text: Better a poor man who walks with integrity than a rich man whose ways are perverse.

7.text: A discerning son keeps the law, but a companion of gluttons disgraces his father.

8.text: He who increases his wealth by interest and usury lays it up for one who is kind to the poor.

9.text: Whoever turns his ear away from hearing the law, even his prayer is detestable.

10.text: He who leads the upright along the path of evil will fall into his own pit, but the blameless will inherit what is good.

11.text: A rich man is wise in his own eyes, but a poor man with discernment sees through him.

12.text: When the righteous triumph, there is great glory, but when the wicked rise, men hide themselves.

13.text: He who conceals his sins will not prosper, but whoever confesses and renounces them will find mercy.

14.text: Blessed is the man who is always reverent, but he who hardens his heart falls into trouble.

15.text: Like a roaring lion or a charging bear is a wicked ruler over a helpless people.

16.text: A leader who lacks judgment is also a great oppressor, but he who hates dishonest profit will prolong his days.

17.text: A man burdened by bloodguilt will flee into the Pit; let no one support him.

18.text: He who walks with integrity will be kept safe, but whoever is perverse in his ways will suddenly fall.

19.text: The one who works his land will have plenty of food, but whoever chases fantasies will have his fill of poverty.

20.text: A faithful man will abound with blessings, but one eager to be rich will not go unpunished.

21.text: To show partiality is not good, yet a man will do wrong for a piece of bread.

22.text: A stingy man hastens after wealth and does not know that poverty awaits him.

23.text: He who rebukes a man will later find more favor than one who flatters with his tongue.

24.text: He who robs his father or mother, saying, “It is not wrong,” is a companion to the man who destroys.

25.text: A greedy man stirs up strife, but he who trusts in the LORD will prosper.

26.text: He who trusts in himself is a fool, but one who walks in wisdom will be safe.

27.text: Whoever gives to the poor will not be in need, but he who hides his eyes will receive many curses.

28.text: When the wicked come to power, people hide themselves; but when they perish, the righteous flourish.
